abstract.t: This memo suggests an advanced mail transfer protocol in order tofind a modern, flexible, extensible, efficient, and robustsuccessor of SMTP. The presented protocol uses a HTTP-ish syntax.It is designed to give the receiver of a message finer control overaccepting or rejecting the message, and to allow negotiation oftransport details. The memo is still in a very early state andintended to initiate a discussion, not to present a finishedprotocol. The protocol can be understood as a workbench for futuremail extensions.
